ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
fortran_compiler:
- gfortran
fortran_compiler_version:
- '14'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - fortran_compiler_version
- - python
  - channel_sources

about.description:
The pymatnest package is a software library for carrying out
nested sampling calculations. It can be used to explore the
energy landscape of different materials (both clusters and
bulk materials), calculate thermodynamic variables at arbitrary
temperatures, locate phase transitions and calculate the phase
diagram. It can be used with LAMMPS, QUIP, and the supplied
fortran models, and both with MC and MD.

The pymatnest package is a software library for carrying out
nested sampling calculations. It can be used to explore the
energy landscape of different materials (both clusters and
bulk materials), calculate thermodynamic variables at arbitrary
temperatures, locate phase transitions and calculate the phase
diagram. It can be used with LAMMPS, QUIP, and the supplied
fortran models, and both with MC and MD.

name: pymatnest
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "pymatnest" %}
{% set version = "0.0.1" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/libAtoms/{{ name }}/archive/master.zip
  sha256: 8d63589f0d0c7d5e266461711aeedb5ca3fe00c76fbb0dcddde5eef9fd215e2f
  patches:
    - arch.patch

build:
  number: 8
  skip: true  # [not linux]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}
    - {{ compiler('fortran') }}
    - make
  host:
    - python
  run:
    - python
    - ase
    - psutil 
    - mpi4py
    - numpy

test:
  imports:
    - ns_analyse
    - ns_run

about:
  home: https://github.com/libAtoms/pymatnest
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: 'Nested Sampling code'

  description: |
    The pymatnest package is a software library for carrying out 
    nested sampling calculations. It can be used to explore the 
    energy landscape of different materials (both clusters and 
    bulk materials), calculate thermodynamic variables at arbitrary 
    temperatures, locate phase transitions and calculate the phase 
    diagram. It can be used with LAMMPS, QUIP, and the supplied 
    fortran models, and both with MC and MD.
  doc_url: http://libatoms.github.io/pymatnest/
  dev_url: https://github.com/libAtoms/pymatnest

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jan-janssen
